data.text:
Innocence

It was Day-1 of school for little Shravu, who was just 2 yrs old then. It was on the previous day that her Amma, Appa and Akka were telling the naughty, talkative little girl not to run around the garden in the rain and call her Teacher as â€œUma mamiâ€ anymore as Uma mami at school was the Head Mistress and would make Big eyes.

The little girl caught this word â€œhead mistressâ€ and was thinking the whole day about it. She asked about it to her Ammaâ€¦ Due to her baby talks, her Mother, unable to understand the word, she said Head means â€œThalaiâ€â€¦. Now things got weirder, Shravu thought Uma mami â€˜s Head would be on the table and itâ€™d make big eyes every time Shravu did something naughty. She felt School was something very funnyâ€¦ Mamiâ€™s head on the table thatâ€™d make big eyes, aunties teaching ABC, food in colorful boxes, water sipper with a belt and lots of papas and babus to play.

Jealousy, Irritation, Hatred, Anger

8 yrs passed, Shravu, a 10 year old tomboy with a bob-cut, got her new pair of spectsâ€¦. A girl with many friends, a gang of her own and a powerful class monitor, loved by all, except that new girl Sahinya who came from Bâ€™lore. On Day-15 at school, Shravu was feeling angry and irritated coz many of her classmates, teachers and even her own gangâ€™s members sympathized that new girl Sahinya, who cried in the class and narrated her â€œaccidentâ€ story to every student, almost every day. Shravu found it so annoying coz she always felt being isolated and lonelyâ€¦. Slowly, everyone started praising Sahinya for all the talents she hadâ€¦ Sahinya could sing well, some even joined Sahinyaâ€™s music classes, she scored more marks, her best friend Chaitanya started ignoring their 7 yr old friendship. While Sahinya drew really well in the art-class, Shravu always stood outside the class coz she drew donkeys instead of cute dogs, mixed all the paints in the paint paletteâ€¦. Shravu was good at playing basketball but Sahinya was better at it and she skated really wellâ€¦. Shravu was now being hated by all in the class, especially her teachers showed great partiality towards Sahinya and Shravu always felt that pain of being ignored, isolatedâ€¦. Sahinya, though had nothing personal against Shravu.

Shravu did have all sort of things against Sahinya and she blamed Sahinya for each and everythingâ€¦. Shravu did have a few best friends , Teachers and her schoolâ€™s Principal who were by her side every timeâ€¦.

Realization:

2 yrs passed and the hatred grew more and moreâ€¦. It was in their 7th stdâ€¦ On the last day of their Annual exam, Shravu was asked to wait for the â€œclass partyâ€ by all her friendsâ€¦. â€œWhy all of a sudden are they asking me to wait for the class party, I am going to leave this school for good, I am shifting to a new place, I will never see their faces againâ€¦ Is this what making them realize my worth, letâ€™s seeâ€ Shravu wonderedâ€¦.. As soon as she entered into their class room, she saw all their friends busily talking to Sahinyaâ€¦Shravu felt ignored and turned to leaveâ€¦. She knew it, Sahinya had something up her sleeves to insult her for one last timeâ€¦. Angry and irritated, Shravu opened the door and walked outâ€¦. Abhishek, her good friend called her and pulled her into the class roomâ€¦. As soon as she entered, some one closed her eyes from behind and walked herâ€¦. Shravu knew it, they were going to empty the thrash bin on her head and make her cryâ€¦.. The person was Sahinya, who closed her eyesâ€¦. â€œShravu, turn backâ€ said Sahinyaâ€¦. There was a medium sized choco-vanilla cake on the table with â€œWe Love you Shravuâ€ written on itâ€¦. There were candles on itâ€¦ Her friend Chaitanya gave her a box full of chocolates, a pen and a greeting cardâ€¦. There were her favorite things, Harry Potter slam book, Mickey mouse toy and a keychain made out of alphabetic beads that read BEST FRIEND neatly designed like a plant with leaves and tiny rosesâ€¦.. Shravu cut the cake and tears welled up her cheeksâ€¦. Sahinya hugged Shravu and apologised for not being good to herâ€¦. â€œSahinya, I am so sorry re, I shouldnâ€™t have hated you these 2 yrsâ€¦. Atleast, I should have been a little good to youâ€¦. You never gave me a chance to be good re Sahinyaâ€¦. now I know how much you like me, but see, you are going off to Chennai and I am shifting my house and going to a new school, see, even God doesnâ€™t wants us to be good friends anymoreâ€¦. but I promise, any day in life we meet each other, we will be in touch through out ok ? â€œ

Fear, Cool, Ticklish in the tummy-feel:

Shravu joined a â€œstrictâ€ school in the 8th std. The atmosphere in the new school was like that of a military regimentâ€¦. So disciplined, so many rules and the worst one being â€œNO TALKING TO BOYSâ€â€¦. The day Shravu joined school, she saw a boy being beaten up black and blue by Sastri sir, for talking to a girlâ€¦ It was in 8th std she for the first time heard the word â€œFuckâ€ being told by every oneâ€¦. She too said â€œWhat the Fuckâ€ , wide eyedâ€¦. Shravu couldnâ€™t control her feelings for the poor boy who was just beaten up by Sastri sir for talking to herâ€¦. She went straight away to the Principal and asked her the reasonâ€¦.. This brave act of hers, to go and talk to the principal, made her the â€œcoolâ€ girl in the schoolâ€¦. Everyone wanted to be-friend herâ€¦. the principal herself liked Shravuâ€™s cool attitude and loâ€™ Shravu was made the schoolâ€™s ASPL (Assistant school pupil leader). It was all on Shravuâ€™s hands nowâ€¦. Shravu had that feel of being celebrated againâ€¦She had no one who could hate herâ€¦. Rules such as â€œNo jeans to school on saturdaysâ€ changed, everyone followed Shravu in everythingâ€¦except that, Shravu was bad at maths and in Keshav sirâ€™s maths class, Shravu stood out atleast once in a week for not doing the previous dayâ€™s homeworkâ€¦ It so became that many of them, just to give company to Shravu, did not purposely do their homework and would stand with her outside the class some timesâ€¦

A year passedâ€¦Shravuâ€™s parents put her for the intensive course and hence, Shravu joined the other intensive branch of the schoolâ€¦.It was in the 9th stdâ€¦â€¦She was now ok in maths coz of that Kalpa School boy Shashank Varma, who clarified all her doubts in mathsâ€¦. He was a very nice guyâ€¦ It was her friends Giddi- Maariyah and Moti- TPS who always said â€œohoâ€¦.ohoâ€¦kya chalra reâ€ when ever they saw Shravu and Shashank talkingâ€¦. Stupid Shravu did not understand why and then this was later explained by her friend Manritâ€¦ Since that day, whenever Shravu saw Shashank, she had that â€œTicklish in the tummyâ€ feelâ€¦.

Competition, Hard-work and Best friends Promises:

It was in her 10th std, that Shravu felt people are racing her in the scoresâ€¦ Shravu had to do something with her scoresâ€¦ Being the SPL for the school, Shravu found it very hard to manage her studiesâ€¦. She had this friend Lallu who helped her constantlyâ€¦. When the bad girl Priyanka scored more than her, Shravu felt the need to score moreâ€¦ It was since that day Shravu put on all her efforts to study much better, score more and set an example to her juniorsâ€¦. She did itâ€¦ In the final SSC boards, she stood one among the top 15 in the schoolâ€¦ After results, it was time to part from her best friends, her gang , the lovely school, her teachers and every thing that had to do with her schoolâ€¦. Especially Lalluâ€¦. She did not want to part from that best friend and that day, she made a promise to her best friend that come what may, we will remain best friends foreverâ€¦.

Anxiety, Tensions, Studiousness, Aims :

Shravu took up Life sciences, in her high school (junior college in Hyderabad) and had nothing much than study,study and studyâ€¦. She was admitted into SCJC Kalasala, one of the famous junior colleges in AP, famous for their targetsâ€¦. 11th std was full of competition for herâ€¦. She did score well, had her titles of â€œTopper, class firstâ€ etcâ€¦. Whenever her lecturer said the word â€œAIMâ€ , Shravu always wondered what it wasâ€¦. She did not have any personal aimâ€¦ She did not know what to become in lifeâ€¦. She had a lot of anxiety and tension in the 12th std, because she was struggling to know her aimâ€¦. She worked hard, but never knew for what she aimedâ€¦. Then one day, after her practical exams, she was told by one of the external lecturers â€œYou will make a great scientistâ€â€¦ She wanted to be a scientistâ€¦. Deep in her heart, she always wanted to be that person whose name would feature in the newspaper constantly, above all the articlesâ€¦. She wanted to be a journalistâ€¦. But life had different plans for herâ€¦. Life wanted her to be a scientistâ€¦

EGO, Pride, Head-strong :

Shravu joined college for university education..She took up Biotechnology, Microbiology and Chemistryâ€¦. All through her college, she had none to fight against her, none to debate with herâ€¦ People feared her more than liking herâ€¦ She topped in studies, excelled in almost everythingâ€¦She was the college presidentâ€¦ She was a terror to those girls who ragged their juniors, she was a counselor to the depressedâ€¦Without her consent no event took place in the collegeâ€¦She won laurels for the college and had a name of her ownâ€¦. She was named â€œHitler-niâ€ â€¦. Girls gossiped about her, being an EGOist, Proud-ish and some really liked her Head-strong attitudeâ€¦. This Ego crept into her a lot that some started to envy herâ€¦. The Ego lead to many losses she never expected in lifeâ€¦.

Confusions, Depression, Talent recognition:

After Shravu graduated, it was on a rainy afternoon, the D-Day, when she was going to collect her marks memo along with her Appa, their 2-wheeler skid down and they met with an accidentâ€¦ Shravu was badly injuredâ€¦she and her father were rushed to hospitalâ€¦.It was there that she found out her spine and left knee have a severe injuryâ€¦She was advised bed rest for atleast 4 monthsâ€¦. Doctors said she can never walk normally for at least a yearâ€¦. Shravuâ€™s eyes welled up with tearsâ€¦She could not attend the convocationâ€¦More than anything her career had got a big blow, â€˜oh shit!â€™ she thoughtâ€¦She was on bed, unable to walkâ€¦All her dreams of doing it big in life shatteredâ€¦. One precious year of her career was lostâ€¦She could not even walk to the loo, what would she do big in life, was Shravuâ€™s biggest questionâ€¦. While all her friends joined college, she sat down, dis-interested, confused and depressed , self-pitying herself every momentâ€¦All that she had was Facebook and few very good online friends who motivated her, though they have never met her in personâ€¦.. Shravu was encouraged and motivated with her friendsâ€™ words, their jokes, and more than all, her boredom was killedâ€¦ It was at that time that she came to know about this MBA program from distanceâ€¦ Shravu was good at Literature and Scienceâ€¦Management was a new thing to herâ€¦ She thought sheâ€™d dare not do an MBA but this was the only option to keep her career on trackâ€¦ She was told that she had the talent to speak well, write wellâ€¦..

Confidence, Encouragement, Motivation, Challenges:

It was 2 months already and Shravu still wasnt out of her bed completelyâ€¦ She tried her best to walk but failedâ€¦It was one day, when her phone rang, she walked from her bed and received the call from her friendâ€¦ After the call Shravu realised that she could walkâ€¦. She walked everyday and as days passed, she did some walking with a little limp to the grocery near her houseâ€¦. Shravu gained a lot of weight and she also hit the gym to lose weightâ€¦Her doctors were shockedâ€¦ She still hated something which was to study for her MBA examsâ€¦She hated it to the coreâ€¦. After her first sem exams, she realized that this will be her challenge in life, to achieve in the field that is new to herâ€¦.

Taste of success-new determination:

After the second semester exams, Shravu slowly started searching for jobsâ€¦She failed several interviewsâ€¦She started gaining interest in Management studiesâ€¦Meanwhile, she also contributed a lot to her collegeâ€™s journalâ€¦. An institute invited her for a motivational lecture for their students, when her article on Emotional Intelligence was published in a local management journalâ€¦ It was since that day onward, she took up training for Public Speaking and soft skillsâ€¦She set up her own niche` among the companiesâ€¦She still did not get the satisfaction of the job she has taken upâ€¦. It was one day, at the bus stop, one boy named Santosh came up to her from his bike and said â€œMadam, I got a job few months agoâ€¦ I got promoted as the accounts manager at XYZ corporation and you know what madam, I am going to the UK to represent our team from India, for a presentationâ€¦. Thank you so much madam, If it was not your training, I wouldnâ€™t be here todayâ€ â€¦ Shravu had the most joyful day that dayâ€¦ She got the taste of successâ€¦. Now, she realized that when her student himself has done something big, why not she? She got a new determination, to finish her MBA, do a P.hD and satisfy the hunger of Doing it big in lifeâ€¦.

Self-Realization:

Today, as the 22 year old Corporate Trainer pens down these words, she realizes that all the feelings, thoughts, events, memories and lessons she learnt in life are the actual boosters of her career in corporate training. She feels that; probably, all the steps she climbed all these years, are preparing her for the actual worldâ€¦ A world of responsibilities, commitments and above all, reach her one and only target â€“ Dr.Shravanthi on her name plate and start an academy, where people are encouraged to be a better person by talent recognition and those who have the aim of Doing it big in life, even without the piece of paper called Degree ğŸ™‚ â€¦.

Join and Wish Shravu in her endeavor of lifeâ€¦. Go-Shravu â€“ Do it big! ..Go-For it!!!

Hey people! Hope you all had a great weekâ€¦ I know weekends are more hectic than weekdays â€“ cleaning, washing, cooking, shopping groceries and finally no rest at all ğŸ˜¦ . Here is something to make you feel lightâ€¦ I am back, a little free from my project and classes, to share with you, some funny incidences, just to lift your spirits and prepare you for the next weekâ€™s work at office â€“ Ipidi daan Indian economy will get boosted, when the working class works enthusiastically ( my project report la idhu daan solli addi vaanginen guide kiterndhu ğŸ˜› ) . Join me for some fun, leg pulling , loads of laughter and yes, might tickle your thoughts a littleâ€¦ ğŸ˜›

Few days ago, I had accompanied my parents to a weddingâ€¦It was on a Sundayâ€¦ My Mind voice was cursing my akka , she escaped from coming to the wedding telling that she had to prepare for the next dayâ€™s board meeting at officeâ€¦ I know she played Candy crush on Fbâ€¦. I was the â€œBali aadu/ Scape Goatâ€ . I had to goâ€¦ I dressed up in my best Kanjivaram Saree (Flashback â€“ â€œMeenu, Kalyanam muhurtham ku podavai kattiko, andha Mumtaz madri Anarkali potundu odd ah irukaadhe, thalai cut pannindrukai nu viruchu potukaadhe, periyavaa irupa anga, enga maanatha kappal la yethaadeâ€¦Ozhunda Adakam Odhukama Vaa, seriya?â€ â€“ My Amma was giving lecture on dressing up). My face was like this -> ğŸ˜¦ ğŸ˜¦ â€¦ and again amma told â€œSidu moonji vechikadhe, sport a smile and come with us. I tried my best not to grit my teeth in anger- My one and only one Sunday was getting ruined, the drive to the Kalyana Mandapam was very long, Bleddy rains, made Hyderabadi roads absolutely Puke-able . My plans to sleep for extra 1 hour got spoilt, I wanted to watch a movie online, that also full flop. We were getting down from the car when Amma got down and â€œIndha jeans um t-shirt um potundu romba kettu poidardhugal kuttigal..Naaliki un kalyanathilayum 9 gajam Madisar vida Pattu trouser um Pattu T-shirt um potu vidaren iruâ€ thittifyingly seri aakified my sareeâ€™s fallâ€¦ I was almost embarrassed at the gate. I knew, I was going to face more crapâ€¦

Now, dear readers, Brace yourselves to know the type of Relatives I haveâ€¦

As soon as we entered into the hall, there was this Panneer thelikara cousinsâ€¦. So here we go,

Type 1 â€“ Panneer sprinkler Cousins: Girls dressed in Pattu Paavadai Daavani, hardly in college and high school are given the job of panneer sprinkling. Here, the situation was different, these girls were actually busy on their girly- discussions and posing for photographs.. As usual the ANNOYING HAND ON HIP poseâ€¦. And some guys, were seen flirting with these girls.. I saw waterfalls flowing from their mouthâ€¦ These girls, totally forget what duty they have been givenâ€¦ So much of Panneer waste-u, po!

Type 2 â€“ Voluntary Reception Committee Members: These relatives, no matter how much ever distant relativeâ€™s marriage it is, they do the work of Receptionist. As soon as some one enters, they wish you with a â€œGood morningâ€ and inform the others that you have arrived â€“ As if we havenâ€™t got an appointment to greet the newly-weds ğŸ˜› .

Type 3 â€“ Aathuku Periyava- Safety lockers: Some 70+ aged periyava, dressed in cotton Madisar or Pancha, sit in some corner of the kalyana mandapam, taking care of their grand children. Bags, slippers and all are left with these people, when the others go on the kalyana stage or to meet others. These people are the ones who get most tired, blessing every one who fall on their feet. My amma and appa asked me also to bend, like, to almost 10 of them sitting in different corners and rooms of the kalyana mandapam, to seek blessings â€ Seekram kalyanam aagattum nokuâ€ and compliments that include hugs and kisses from very sweet paatis â€ Ethra azhaga irukai di kozhandei nee, unga amma chinnapo ipidi daan irundaaâ€ and some spice from thathas â€ Unga appa ipidi daan gaeli panni pesuvan, avanodu korangu thanam ellam noku apdiye vandhirukkuâ€. No, I did not miss my gym that day, so much of bending must have burnt more calories, than,that Iâ€™d burn on my daily workout sessions ğŸ˜› . But I did feel nice seeing many thathas and Paatis, I did not miss my thatha and Pechammai that day â¤ .

Type 4- Ever-youth Aunties and Uncles : Some 45+ aunties and uncles, dressed in their best sexiest-semi-traditional outfits. They are usually seen as couples, posing to be the best â€œlove-jodiâ€ and still young after 20 yrs of marriageâ€¦ Some even koo-chi-koo and show PDA there â€“ Un-Sahikable of all you know!

Type 5- Advisers, Flirts, Show off-ers and Vetty Fellows : When you attend a kalyanam, you are introduced to a new group of cousinsâ€¦.

Advisers-The 28-30 yr old cousins, usually Foreign return- jobless-or IITians, dressed up in Veshti, with thin rimmed specs, advice you about career, research, life, philosophy and what not! These guyz are mostly the center of attraction among fat-flabby aunties and uncles, pecked and followed to get married to their daughters.

Flirts â€“ The not so handsome according to me, type of guys, feel off like they are Manmadhans and Kameshwarans. Buffaloes! They flirt with every possible girl in the kalyanamâ€¦. As if their only purpose is to â€œPataofyâ€ a girl in the kalyana mandapamâ€¦ I find these guys are like those dogs, which chase vehicles, with no intention of driving them. I am always a Lady Hitler to these Flirts, they hate me to the core coz I ridicule them a lot â€“ Who cares? ğŸ˜›

Show off-ers- Uff, these girls, mostly my age (22-25) , when I think I can break the ice with some good general topic, all they blabber is about their boy friends, shopping, slippers, nail-polishâ€¦Some half-mad and 3/4th Mad girls end up being Price Tags yaar! All they speak is about the branded accessories they boughtâ€¦. I canâ€™t help laughing wickedly, knowing from where they actually purchased the so-called Branded stuff ğŸ˜› ğŸ˜€ .

Vetty-Fellows â€“ I love this , â€œmy-typeâ€ cousinsâ€¦ They are cool, fun and above all, they join me in making fun of people ğŸ˜› .

Type 6- Gossip Box, Suggestion box, Double meaners, Loud mouth and Boasters :

Gossip Box: Mostly mamis who gossip about anyone, no matter they know the person or notâ€¦They make great story writers ğŸ˜› .

Suggestion box: These are mamis and mamas who keep giving useless suggestionsâ€¦ Like, if you wear a saree and you plait your hair, they say â€œkonjam poo vechundrukalam ayirundhuthuâ€ and you are like â€œnods head like a boom boom maaduâ€ to all that they say.

Double meaners : They are the most idiotic people, youâ€™d ever get to see in this world. Anything you speak, they mean it the other way round. You talk to a guy and they say â€œeyy eyy, enna maa, romba otti otti nikkarai, enna un aala ivanâ€ and you are like â€œhuh, paithyama, he is my broâ€!

Loud Mouth: Their voices are so loud, that even when you tell a very personal secret, it doesnâ€™t remain one! They whisper so loudâ€¦Their voices are heard louder than the Ghetti-melam and nadaswaram. ğŸ˜›

Boasters: The most ANNOYING, IRRITATING, BLEDDY CREATURES you ever get to see in the gatherings. Be it a wedding or a funeral, they just canâ€™t stop boasting about their children, sons-in-law, daughters-in-law, husband, mamiyar, mamanar and even their Dogâ€™s poop! They boast so much and compare their pet dogâ€™s poop with that of your petâ€™s, that you sometimes end up feeling guilty or at least think for a moment that your Pet is a constipate! ğŸ˜›

Type-7 The Good , Bad and Worst eaters : I never compromise when it comes to foodâ€¦ Enga pona enna, Kalyanam nu vandha, nambalukku soru thaan mukhiyum ğŸ˜€ . There are these Good eaters, who make a great company for you while eating.

There are these bad eaters, who stare at your plate or plantain leaf while you are relishing a good dish and make constipate-acidity-fart from mouth- facesâ€¦It is so irritating that at some point you feel like slapping them hard on their face and tie their eyes up and continue relishing the mysour-turned mysore pak.

Worst eaters are worser than worst! They eat and make a mess on the table or floor, so much that you end up puking on your plate. These people really need a â€œgood table mannersâ€ orientation class.

There are many more crazy relatives who pose like Singers, Dancers, Highest officials, Match makers etc., about whom, you all already knowâ€¦.

So, these are the types of relatives I haveâ€¦ I know, you too will have similar people in your families, without these people, we seriously wouldnâ€™t have so much to get irritated, crib or laugh about. Our relatives are unique, irritating and at the same time, very funny people, without them , any function, funeral or any public gathering is incompleteâ€¦..

Note: If any reader finds his/her character matching with the stereotypes I have mentioned, donâ€™t run around to hit me ğŸ˜› ğŸ˜› ğŸ˜›

Keep laughing and Spread laughterâ€¦

Meenu (Aarya) .

Hello, Namaskaram to all my dear readersâ€¦. Well, idhu varai naan ezhudina short stories ellam fictionâ€¦ I got a chance to write a real, on going love story- A Pakka Namba aathu fresh and hot filter coffee madri story, of my friends Revathi and Ashwinâ€¦.. Naangal Whatsapp la pesindu irukarche, Revathi avalodu Love story sonna, which I found to be worthy enough, to be on my blogâ€¦. Come on, with me, let us travel to Chennai, with a cup of nice hot filter kaapi and a plate full of Bhajjis and thottuka thengai chutneyâ€¦..

Chennai â€“ 2005:

Chennai â€“ A busy city, rich in our culture, tradition and yes, fully filled with namba Tambrahmsâ€¦.. Chennai MaaNagarathula oru area, Kolathur, anga in a cute yet Traditional Iyengar household, lives Revathiâ€¦. Daughter of Mr. & Mrs. Santhanamâ€¦.

Revathiiiiiiiiiiiiiâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦kelambiyaacha ma?? School ku late aagardhu, inniki noku exam veraâ€¦.

Idho varen Ammaâ€¦â€¦

Revathi, a 9th grader, smart, sweet, chirpy, bubbly- yet very kind girl, studies in Kulapathi Dr. BalaKrishna Schoolâ€¦.

Revathi, final exam daane, youâ€™ll do really well, Hayagrivar unna kaapathuvar, tension eduthukade..Naan unakaaga vendikarenâ€¦.

Revathiâ€™s appa, Mr. Santhanam says looking at his little girl tensed at the breakfast table.

Meanwhile, In Revathiâ€™s mind â€œ Haiyo, exam ellaam periya prachanaiye illai Appaâ€¦Indha Ashwin paiyan mela naan vechrukardhu nijama ve love ah, illai verum attraction ah, onnume puriyaliyeâ€¦.â€

Paathela makkale, indha 9th grader mind la enna iruku nu? ğŸ˜›

Kulapathi Dr. S. Balakrishna Joshi School â€“ Chennai â€“ May 2005 :

Ella kadhai layum hero entry super ah, dashing ah irukum, indha kadhai la twist paarungoâ€¦.

Revathi reaches schoolâ€¦. â€œ Revathi, yaaru ma kozhandei, andha paiyan, ipidi sandai podaran, NARAYANA, poonool vera teriyardhu shirt lerndhu, ipidi sandai podaran, avaaloda laam nee friendship eh vechika koodadhu, seriya ma? Chamatha exam ezhuditu vaa,last exam verai, sheekrama mudichutu aathuku vaa, Weâ€™ll go to Parthasarathy Perumal Koil and from there, a nice Dinner at Saravana Bhavan. ok? â€

â€œSeri Appa, ğŸ™‚ â€

Meanwhile Revathiâ€™s mind voice , â€œAppa Ipidi elaam bomb podaraangale, haiyoâ€¦. Appa, ivan daan appa Ashwin, I like him Appaâ€¦. Ippove neengal ipidi chonna epidi paa? NARAYANAAAAâ€¦.. ğŸ˜¦ â€

Revathi, Chamatha finished her 9th grade with a decent score of 95.5% and entered into 10th gradeâ€¦.

It all started in their 10th gradeâ€¦ Revathiâ€™s feelings for Ashwin Iyer grew day by dayâ€¦. She liked his Morattu Kaalai temperment, His Short temper, his smile, his talks,â€¦ Every thing he did, attracted Revathi, even the way he wrote notes attracted herâ€¦.

During class hours Revathi would stare at Ashwin silently from the corner of her eye, just to ensure he is in the classâ€¦. She even got caught and scolded by her Teachers once or twice for not being attentive in classâ€¦.

â€œWho cares, I like looking at Ashwin, I will look at him, classes and lessons eppidiyo pogattumâ€ saying so in her mind, Revathi chuckled, when her Tamil Teacher was scolding herâ€¦. ğŸ˜€ ğŸ˜€ ğŸ˜€

All over her 10th grade, Revathi only thought about Ashwin, apart from studies. She still doubted if this was actually the right age to fall in loveâ€¦. The academic year passed onâ€¦. It was in the Margazhi Maasam, Revathi realised she was Actually in love with Ashwinâ€¦. Thoughts about separating from Ashwin after 10th grade, actually gave a lot of pain to Revathiâ€™s heartâ€¦ She wanted to convey it to her guy, she thought various tricks including writing a note to him, nothing worked outâ€¦.

May 2006:

â€œI am going to propose Ashwin, come what may, I donâ€™t care, I donâ€™t want to lose himâ€¦At any cost, I will propose himâ€ â€¦ Revathi thought for herselfâ€¦
